/* Reaction to John Lennon's murder */ link goes to unrelated material
/* Creative outlets */ UK date format, per subject and rest of article
/* Pseudonyms */ not really necessary for this article. maybe for the songs.
remove fair-use violations. per [[WP:NFCC]] #8 "Non-free content is used only if its presence would significantly increase readers' understanding of the topic". here, the use is largely decorative.
/* Recreational drug use */ largely irrelevant picture
/* 2000s */ a music festival run by the [[British Broadcasting Corporation]]
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 216051926 by [[Special:Contributions/Palzoo|Palzoo]] ([[User talk:Palzoo|talk]])rv - a link to a site which is a (part) a mirror of WP? Ummm... no, ta!
we pretty much agreed that we wouldn't mention every woman he's seen with
gramatical change, Macca wasn't famous for forming the band but being in it, plus a chance to link the other members early on.
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 215821029 by [[Special:Contributions/71.123.215.232|71.123.215.232]] ([[User talk:71.123.215.232|talk]])George didn't form part of the Lennon/McCartney publishing team
/* Recreational drug use */ this is not an American centred article please keep to British use

/* 2000s */ Honorary Doctorate of Music from Yale
qualify, seems that there were some chaps called Lennon, Harrison, Sutcliffe and Best who were also there
He was a founder along with Lennon, Harrison and Sutcliffe - and Pete Best - and this has been the consensus for some time.
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 214985376 by [[Special:Contributions/128.36.80.121|128.36.80.121]] ([[User talk:128.36.80.121|talk]])unsure that this is a major award - he has many such honorary degrees

Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/Tequesta|Tequesta]] ([[User talk:Tequesta|talk]]) to last version by Neil916
I'm sorry, but it's simply not accurate to say McCartney co-founded the Beatles. The group went through various members and names. Only Lennon was along the entire way.
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/Notoriousnicco|Notoriousnicco]] ([[User talk:Notoriousnicco|talk]]) to last version by Andreasegde
/* 1960–1970: The Beatles */ Photo of waxworks gone. Ultra!'s little joke about McCartney being dead or not real has gone too far.
While not a member of The Quarrymen, he was a member of Johnny & the Moondogs and The Silver Beatles and was therefore a founding Beatle along with Best?, Sutcliffe and Harrison
Since McCartney is ESSENTIALLY a singer, bass guitarist, and songwriter (not necessarily in that order), these 3 should be named 1st (and singer & songwriter should not be lumped together).
Let's keep this simple and direct (and accurate: the group that eventually became the Beatles did not originally include McCartney).
This is ridiculous. He has no reputation as a poet or a painter.
/* Marriage to Linda Eastman */ I moved Linda's photo to the the left, because I think it helps the article.
/* Activism */ An ego can grow out of control, but vandals don't know that.
/* 1957–1960: The Quarrymen and the Silver Beetles */

/* Creative outlets */ Now Mr Flame can go pratice his English punctuation
/* Recreational drug use */ photo back in
Edited two sentences around Band on the Run.

"Sir" is not part of a name, it's a title. One would not put: "Mr." Jimmy Page, or "Mr" Bob Dylan into an encyclopedia
